Line 34: Line 34:  
What is the standard for morality is considered to be the continued existence of survival. Survival works as middle junction, wherein well-being and death are possible. These two states are only possible in thought, in morality, as so long a life-form survives, and has consciousness of its biological relationship to the external world. Those things which are thought to cause well being are consequences that maintain the survival of the being(s). That which causes harm moves the existence of the being into a closeness to death.
 
What is the standard for morality is considered to be the continued existence of survival. Survival works as middle junction, wherein well-being and death are possible. These two states are only possible in thought, in morality, as so long a life-form survives, and has consciousness of its biological relationship to the external world. Those things which are thought to cause well being are consequences that maintain the survival of the being(s). That which causes harm moves the existence of the being into a closeness to death.
    −
This is a realist and biological take on morality. It does not base morality on good or bad, so much as it bases morality on actual biological reactions and life's relation to other life. Each life form has different relations to its own species and other species', and every culture and person may have different methods of harming and caring for its members. In this theory harming is not so much wrong as it not caring, and caring is not so much right as it not harming.
+
This is a realist and biological take on morality. It does not base morality on good or bad, so much as it bases morality on actual biological reactions and life's relation to other life. Each life form has different relations to its own species and other species, and every culture and person may have different methods of harming and caring for its members. In this theory harming is not so much wrong as it not caring, and caring is not so much right as it not harming.
     
Harm/Care is a ratio, and also may be thought of with an emotional registration of negative/positive. The ratio between these forces of the mind are known for causing cognitive dissonance or internal or external conflicts (as in other's wants vs. self wants). The consequence that causes the most amount of care possible is the most beneficial, and that which causes the most harm is detrimental. One can weigh possible outcomes, in a ratio, and how they translate back into the dichotomy of well-being vs. death. This is also called risk/benefit analysis.

The ratio between these forces of the mind are known for causing cognitive dissonance or internal or external conflicts (as in other's wants vs. self wants). The consequence that causes the most amount of care possible is the most beneficial, and that which causes the most harm is detrimental. One can weigh possible outcomes, in a ratio, and how they translate back into the dichotomy of well-being vs. death. This is also called risk/benefit analysis.
    −
Emotion works as a dual force, as understood by the psychologist [[Kurt Lewin|Lewin]] as Aversion/Desire (approach/avoid). We start by translating all emotion into this frame-work.
+
EMOTION works as a dual force, as understood by the psychologist [[Kurt Lewin|Lewin]] as Aversion/Desire (approach/avoid). We start by translating all emotion into the these context.
     
Flight-Fight system – The brain engages in a reaction of avoidance or defense/offense in response to threat. A ratio between strength and fear will determine if the threat has a response of d/o or aversion. Fear is a negative feeling, which is usually trigger by stimulus which is thought of as "threat." This a flight response (along with sadness, disgust, hate) that may be overpowered by anger in a fight response. Environmental conditions, and external influence can play a role in the determination of any response.
 
Flight-Fight system – The brain engages in a reaction of avoidance or defense/offense in response to threat. A ratio between strength and fear will determine if the threat has a response of d/o or aversion. Fear is a negative feeling, which is usually trigger by stimulus which is thought of as "threat." This a flight response (along with sadness, disgust, hate) that may be overpowered by anger in a fight response. Environmental conditions, and external influence can play a role in the determination of any response.
Line 62: Line 62:  
Clinical depression may be thought of as being an overall negative association or negative frequent reactions with the world one lives in. This means that therapist and those that are trying to recover from depression should venture to gain more positive or caring results from their decisions.
 
Clinical depression may be thought of as being an overall negative association or negative frequent reactions with the world one lives in. This means that therapist and those that are trying to recover from depression should venture to gain more positive or caring results from their decisions.

Biological relation to other animals: Prey-predator relationships. There is a necessary harming that goes on between feuding species, that feed off of one another.
+
Prey-predator relationships. There is a necessary harming that goes on between feuding species, that feed off of one another.
  +   +
There is a debate about self-interest vs. the interest of others, which should be a priority? Many moral philosophers have worked to declare one-side of the other is better. As a child develops in a healthy family it takes on responsibility till it can take care of itself. When it can, it may start a family unit, where care is divided between the members.
    −
Another conflict of debate, argued by moralists is self-responsibility vs. altruism. There should be a level of caring that permits responsibility. IN most modern cultures, as a child develops it takes on more responsibility, till it can earn enough money to take care of itself, satisfying itself fulfilling a economic purpose. The working adult than may take on more responsibility by starting a family, where care is divided among the healthy members of the family.
